item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Friday, January 10, 2025 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Announcing Rust 1.84.0 (54 points | 8 comments)
2. dnsclay: DNS UPDATE/AXFR/NOTIFY to many custom DNS operator APIs gateway (9 points | 8 comments)
3. Northeastern’s redesign of the Khoury curriculum abandons the fundamentals of computer science (26 points | 47 comments)
4. Pushing the whole company into the past on purpose (16 points | 2 comments)
5. Not every user owns an iPhone (31 points | 34 comments)
6. Alloy 6.2.0 released (12 points | no comments)
7. 16GB Raspberry Pi 5 available now (35 points | 27 comments)
8. A Pixel Parable (19 points | 5 comments)
9. Designing Code For Forward Progress (4 points | no comments)
10. IP-over-Toslink (12 points | 2 comments)
11. Comptime as Configuration (2 points | 2 comments)
12. UK Users: Lobsters needs your help with the Online Safety Act (321 points | 150 comments)
13. broccoli: A robust message queue system for Rust applications, designed as a Rust alternative to Celery (38 points | 11 comments)
14. Shaping Ligatures in Monospace Fonts (3 points | no comments)
15. Google & Linux Foundation Launch "Supporters of Chromium-Based Browsers" Fund (5 points | 4 comments)
16. End-to-end testing emails (5 points | 1 comment)
17. WorstFit: Unveiling Hidden Transformers in Windows ANSI (6 points | 1 comment)
18. Fast(er) JavaScript on WebAssembly: Portable Baseline Interpreter and Future Plans (3 points | 1 comment)
19. Release UCM Desktop v1.0.0 (1 points | 1 comment)
20. How Honeybadger migrated from Sidekiq to Karafka (2 points | no comments)
21. Can LLMs write better code if you keep asking them to “write better code”? (4 points | no comments)
22. Name Collision of the Year: Vector (10 points | 2 comments)
23. Process creation in io_uring (12 points | 1 comment)
24. Why isn't `__attribute__((cleanup(...)))` more known? (1 points | 3 comments)
25. Some Programming Language Ideas (41 points | 23 comments)
item.guid: Lobsters Top Stories: Friday, January 10, 2025 at 8:20 AM UTC
